item.title: Taming Election Data Chaos with Makefiles
item.description:
Why Makefiles Matter in Computational Social Science

I discovered makefiles out of desperation. Five years ago, I was tasked with integrating official election results from different German states into a single database. The project quickly turned into a data nightmare. Each state provided results in different formatsâ€”some as XML, others as CSV files with double headers, and several as Excel spreadsheets with structures that changed over time. None offered a clean API.
